articleinfo.title: The Linux Documentation Project Weekly News

listitem.para: Kai Schlachter polished up the documentation he wrote about the installation process of glibc, had a crashcourse in docbook and sent in his contribution, which he would like to call the Glibc HOWTO. It's not complete yet: Kai still needs to finetune this document to be compliant with the new glibc.

Lars Strand wrote an OLSR IPv6 HOWTO (source XML + images), describing this routing protocol for mobile ad-hoc networks. The document has had a technical review, of which you can find the result here, but Lars admits that a language review might be a valuable thing.

Michael Schlenstedt is working on an ISDN HOWTO, explaining ISDN-support in 2.6 kernels. In the new kernels a lot has changed and Michael wants to describe installation and give some background information about CAPI and ISDN4Linux so as to be able to do the troubleshooting.
Luigi Bitoni proposed a text documenting the combination of Apache, Tomcat, Sun's JDK and mod_jk. Luc De Louw suggested to co-operate so as he could concentrate on his MMBase Installation HOWTO.
Mendel Cooper has bugfixes and more examples in the Advanced Bash Scripting Guide v2.5.
Major points of attention in v0.7 of the LVM HOWTO are the inclusion of a discussion about LVM 2 and the addition of a FAQ section. Author AJ Lewis made RedHat the copyright holder.

sect2.title: Iceland Icenet mirror moved
sect2.para: Albert Ragnarsson let us know that the TLDP mirror over at http://www.eldveggir.com/eldveggur/LDP/ no longer exists because he dropped the domain. A replacement is available from . This mirror is updated daily.

sect1.title: HOWTO contribute to TLDP
sect1.para: The Linux Documentation Project (TLDP) is working on developing free, high quality documentation for the GNU/Linux operating system. If you want to help TLDP, consider joining discuss-subscribe@en.tldp.org.

Help us create this newsletter. We need volunteers who follow the community (mailing lists, newsgroups, web channels) and report events related to free software documentation. Write to us at feedback@en.tldp.org.
The LDP Weekly News is compiled and edited by Machtelt Garrels and Y Giridhar Appaji Nag with help from several other people.
